title: Add loss/metric breakdown
description: Log and report training/eval losses and key metrics in a consistent schema so different environments can compare results.
acceptance_criteria: Loss terms + key metrics are emitted in a machine-readable format (json/csv) and covered by a small unit test.

comments.author: akira
comments.text: Added consistent machine-readable loss/metrics reporting: yolozu/metrics_report.py (JSON, JSONL append, single-row CSV, flattening). Wired into rtdetr_pose/tools/train_minimal.py via --metrics-jsonl/--metrics-json/--metrics-csv to emit loss breakdown + avg loss. Added unit test tests/test_metrics_report.py.

title: YOLO26 competition toolchain (Apache2)
description: Track toolchain needed to beat YOLO26 e2e mAP (COCO detect) per size bucket, without relying on GPL/AGPL code. Use external inference to export JSON, then evaluate in this repo.
acceptance_criteria: Can generate/validate predictions JSON for 5 sizes; eval_suite produces COCO e2e mAP; check_map_targets passes vs yolo26 targets; leaderboard table is reproducible.
notes: Status: dfd.1/dfd.5 done; dfd.3 docs done (external training run + predictions JSON still pending). dfd.2 blocked on external YOLO26 predictions JSON. xxm wiring in progress; RTDETR pose adapter runs on coco128 CPU and baseline.json can be generated, but real outputs needed before gate tuning.

title: Define YOLO26 eval protocol + target table
description: Lock down evaluation protocol for the YOLO26 competition: dataset split(s), bbox format, e2e mAP definition (no NMS), and reporting schema.
acceptance_criteria: A short doc exists (repo-local) + an automated check that eval settings match the doc; targets file (baselines/yolo26_targets.json) is validated and referenced by README/tools.

title: Reproduce YOLO26 baseline predictions and import
description: Run YOLO26 (or a permitted baseline implementation) externally and export predictions JSON for all size buckets (n/s/m/l/x), then evaluate with eval_suite.
acceptance_criteria: reports/pred_yolo26{n,s,m,l,x}.json (or equivalent) produced + validate_predictions passes + eval_suite.json generated and archived; includes exact command lines/hardware notes.
notes: Ran smoke test on coco128 with dummy predictions via import_yolo26_baseline.py --protocol none --dry-run. Archive: baselines/yolo26_runs/2026-01-31T07-33-28Z (run.json + eval_suite.json).

comments.author: akira
comments.text: Added pinned baseline import+archive flow: tools/import_yolo26_baseline.py (validates pred_yolo26*.json, runs tools/eval_suite.py --protocol yolo26, archives to baselines/yolo26_runs/<run-id>/ with run.json + eval_suite.json). Docs: docs/yolo26_baseline_repro.md and baselines/yolo26_runs/README.md. Next: run external YOLO26 (or permitted impl) on COCO val2017 to generate real pred_yolo26{n,s,m,l,x}.json and re-run the importer (omit --dry-run).

comments.author: akira
comments.text: Started: hardened tools/import_yolo26_baseline.py to require exactly one file for each bucket yolo26n/s/m/l/x (fails loudly if missing/duplicate) and records bucket_files mapping in run.json. Next step still needs the real external YOLO26 prediction JSONs to be placed somewhere matching the glob (recommended: reports/pred_yolo26{n,s,m,l,x}.json), then run the importer to archive eval_suite.json + metadata.

comments.author: akira
comments.text: Smoke pipeline OK (non-protocol): generated dummy yolo26{n,s,m,l,x} JSONs via tools/make_dummy_predictions.py on coco128 and ran tools/import_yolo26_baseline.py --dataset data/coco128 --protocol none --split train2017 --dry-run. Output eval_suite.json at reports/eval_suite.json and archive at /tmp/yolo26_runs_smoke/smoke-coco128. Real completion still requires full COCO val2017 + real YOLO26 predictions JSONs.

title: Training recipe v1 (augment/multiscale/schedule)
description: Establish a strong baseline training recipe for COCO detect: augmentation (mosaic/mixup/copy-paste/etc), multi-scale, optimizer/schedule, EMA, and deterministic seeding.
acceptance_criteria: Recipe is documented; a run can be reproduced to within tolerance; produces predictions JSON that improves over initial baseline on coco128/val subset.
notes:
Baseline pipeline now can run adapter outputs (tools/run_baseline.py) for quick sanity, but acceptance still requires external training run + improved predictions JSON.
Expanded training_recipe_v1 with determinism flags, aug schedule, and optimizer implementation notes. Still pending external training run + improved predictions JSON.
Tried external run in repo: downloaded coco128 subset (manual due to SSL mismatch), ran rtdetr_pose train_minimal (2 epochs, batch=2) and exported predictions. COCO eval mAP50-95=0.0; no improvement. Need real trained model/predictions JSON from external training to meet acceptance.

title: Knowledge distillation (teacher→student)
description: Add distillation (logits/feature distill) from a larger teacher to improve smaller size buckets without changing eval protocol.
acceptance_criteria: Distillation can be enabled/disabled via config; shows measurable mAP gain on a fixed eval subset; training logs include distill loss terms.
notes: Blocked: requires real training/inference pipeline + teacher model; not available in macOS-only env.

title: Hyperparameter sweep harness
description: Automate HPO (LR, wd, aug strength, resolution, matching/loss weights) and collect results into a comparable report.
acceptance_criteria: A single command (script or documented procedure) runs a sweep and outputs a table (csv/md) of settings→metrics; supports resuming.
notes: Added sweep harness (tools/hpo_sweep.py), mock trainer (tools/mock_train.py), and example config (docs/hpo_sweep_example.json). Smoke run: python3 tools/hpo_sweep.py --config docs/hpo_sweep_example.json --resume --max-runs 1 (outputs to reports/ + runs/hpo/*).

title: E2E mAP score calibration (no NMS)
description: Improve e2e mAP without NMS by calibrating classification/objectness scores (e.g., temperature scaling, focal tweaks) and selecting consistent score thresholds for reporting.
acceptance_criteria: Provides a calibration method + before/after comparison on a fixed eval subset; documented settings + saved calibration artifacts if needed.
notes: Blocked by YOLOZU-dfd.2 and lack of real baseline predictions; needs real outputs to calibrate scores.

title: ONNX export parity + validation
description: Export the chosen model to ONNX and validate numerical parity of predictions JSON vs PyTorch reference (within tolerance).
acceptance_criteria: Export procedure documented; a parity checker exists (sample images) and fails loudly on mismatch; produces identical bbox format/labels.

comments.author: akira
comments.text: Added generic parity checker tools/check_predictions_parity.py (matches detections by class+IoU, checks bbox/score tolerances) and documentation docs/onnx_export_parity.md. This unblocks ONNX-vs-PyTorch numerical parity validation once a concrete model/export path exists.

title: TensorRT FP16/INT8 pipeline
description: Build TRT engine(s) (FP16, optional INT8) from ONNX, with calibration data and reproducible build scripts.
acceptance_criteria: Engine build is reproducible; outputs predictions JSON matching ONNX within tolerance; optional INT8 shows speedup with acceptable mAP drop.

title: Latency/FPS benchmark harness (target HW)
description: Measure throughput/latency on target hardware for each size bucket and store results in the same report schema.
acceptance_criteria: A benchmark runner produces a JSON report with fps/latency + links to engine/model; can compare runs over time.

title: Leaderboard report for eval_suite.json
description: Add a leaderboard generator that summarizes reports/eval_suite.json to markdown/tsv and optionally compares to yolo26 target mAP.
acceptance_criteria: tools/print_leaderboard.py prints md/tsv/json; shows value/target/delta; sorts by metric.

title: Task aligner
description: Implement/define a task aligner (multi-task weighting / label-space alignment) to make metrics comparable across tasks.
acceptance_criteria: A minimal implementation exists + docs on how to use it; includes a deterministic test or example that shows the alignment changes outputs as expected.

comments.author: akira
comments.text: Implemented minimal multi-task loss aligner: rtdetr_pose/rtdetr_pose/task_aligner.py (uncertainty-weighted alignment) + wiring into rtdetr_pose/rtdetr_pose/losses.py via Losses(task_aligner=...). train_minimal now supports --use-uncertainty + --task-aligner uncertainty. Docs: docs/task_aligner.md. Deterministic test: tests/test_task_aligner.py.

title: Normalize predictions (category_id↔class_id)
description: Implement a tool to normalize predictions JSON class ids using labels/<split>/classes.json (category_id -> class_id, or treating class_id as category_id).
acceptance_criteria: tools/normalize_predictions.py exists with unit tests; supports category_id and class_id remapping; preserves wrapper shape.

title: Wire real training/inference repo for real metrics
description:
From todo_symmetry_commonsense_realtime.md: current gates/metrics are validated against scaffolded baseline (reports/baseline.json), not a real model.

Acceptance criteria:
- Add/point adapter to an actual training+inference implementation (RT-DETR / pose pipeline)
- Run scenario suite end-to-end on real outputs
- Produce updated baseline report (metrics + fps) with same schema
- Ensure existing gates (constraints, symmetry-aware metrics) still pass or adjust thresholds with rationale

Notes:
- Keep realtime gating logic out of TRT graph where possible
- Preserve existing report schema + CI scenario runner
notes: Wired real inference path using in-repo rtdetr_pose; adapter runs on coco128 CPU; scenario runner + baseline.json generated; gates check passes (scaffolded metrics). Remaining improvements depend on higher-quality trained weights.

title: Select real model repo + interface
description:
Decide the concrete training/inference implementation to wire (e.g., rtdetr_pose package vs external repo) and define the minimal adapter interface needed by scenario runner.

Acceptance:
- Document target entrypoints (train/infer/export)
- Identify inputs/outputs needed by yolozu runner/metrics
- Confirm how to obtain predictions deterministically for tests
notes: Documented in-repo rtdetr_pose as current real-model choice + entrypoints/IO/determinism in docs/real_model_interface.md.

title: Implement adapter to real inference
description:
Implement adapter that calls the chosen inference pipeline and returns outputs in the schema expected by yolozu pipeline/metrics.

Acceptance:
- Adapter runs on coco128 smoke subset
- Produces required keys for report generation
notes:
RTDETR pose adapter runs on coco128 smoke subset via local venv (torch CPU):
- ./.venv/bin/python tools/export_predictions.py --adapter rtdetr_pose --dataset data/coco128 --max-images 5 --image-size 160 --score-threshold 0.01 --max-detections 10 --wrap --output reports/predictions_rtdetr_pose.json
- python3 tools/validate_predictions.py reports/predictions_rtdetr_pose.json --strict (OK)
Adapter import fixed by adding repo_root/rtdetr_pose to sys.path in yolozu/adapter.py.

title: Run scenarios on real outputs
description:
Wire scenario runner to use the real adapter end-to-end.

Acceptance:
- tools/run_scenarios.py (or equivalent) completes
- Report schema unchanged
notes:
Scenario runner completed with RTDETR pose adapter on coco128 smoke subset:
- ./.venv/bin/python tools/run_scenarios.py --adapter rtdetr_pose --dataset data/coco128 --max-images 5 --image-size 160 --score-threshold 0.01 --max-detections 10
Output: reports/scenario_run.json (schema unchanged).

title: Generate new baseline.json from real model
description:
Run baseline pipeline using real model outputs and write updated reports/baseline.json.

Acceptance:
- Baseline reproducible (document command)
- Includes metrics + fps
notes: Re-ran baseline on full coco128 (no max-images) after installing numpy: ./.venv/bin/python tools/run_baseline.py --adapter rtdetr_pose --dataset data/coco128 --image-size 160 --score-threshold 0.01 --max-detections 10 --output reports/baseline.json --predictions-out reports/predictions_rtdetr_pose_baseline.json --wrap (fps≈10.24 on CPU; recall/map proxies 0.0 for this tiny scaffold)

title: Re-tune gates/thresholds (if needed)
description:
If real outputs violate existing gates, adjust thresholds with rationale and update docs/tests accordingly.

Acceptance:
- Gates pass in CI
- Changes justified in notes
notes: Gate retuning not applicable yet: baseline metrics from RTDETR scaffold on coco128 are not representative (recall/map proxies 0.0). Deferring threshold changes until real model outputs available.

title: Apache2 inference exporter skeleton (ONNXRuntime/TRT)
description: Provide Apache-2.0-friendly inference exporter skeletons for ONNX Runtime and TensorRT to produce YOLOZU predictions JSON (NMS-free), with fixed preprocessing (imgsz=640) and config capture.
acceptance_criteria: Documented CLI stubs exist; outputs predictions JSON schema; deterministic and reproducible; no GPL deps.

comments.author: akira
comments.text: Implemented Apache-2.0-friendly inference exporter skeletons: tools/export_predictions_onnxrt.py (generic ORT runner with letterbox@640, no NMS, maps input-space xyxy boxes back to original and outputs cxcywh_norm) and tools/export_predictions_trt.py (dry-run + runtime skeleton placeholder). Added helper yolozu/letterbox.py, docs update in docs/yolo26_baseline_repro.md, and tests/test_exporter_skeletons.py (dry-run mode).
